subject: Data
title: A/B Testing: Statistics Meets Silicon Valley
description: A micro-lesson that makes A/B Testing: Statistics Meets Silicon Valley usable.

hook.text: Google once tested 41 shades of blue for a link color. The winning shade earned $200 million more per year.

buildup.text: A/B testing shows two versions of something to random users and measures which performs better.

discovery.text: It's the randomized controlled trial applied to websites â€” the same statistical logic, digital scale.

twist.text: Tech companies run thousands of A/B tests simultaneously. Every button you see was statistically optimized.

climax.text: A/B testing turned Fisher's 1920s statistics into a trillion-dollar industry practice.

punchline.text: Every click you make was tested against an alternative.

quiz.question: What is A/B testing fundamentally based on?
